column4: disappearedng_:why do you do that if you're very new to linux ??
1) I am not very new, 2) I need to recompile with CONFIG_UFS_FS_WRITE=y so that I can access my FFS systems
yes, xorg has changd but still 'listens' to xorg.conf
disappearedng_:ok then, thought so because of your request for partis
yeah
well when I recompiled my kernel in FreeBSD, there's a config file for me to pick options from
when I read the documentation it didn't say much, it just says it's located in debian/config/ARCH/
Oh nvm
disappearedng_:http://brainstorm.ubuntu.com/idea/6523/
MK131:you could use fdisk or dd, see man for the cmd's
Where do I find   debian/config/i386/ then ?
disappearedng_:no idea, but you can read ffs , nor ? try from live cd
I can read but not write
it's on http://wiki.netbsd.se/How_to_mount_FFS_partition_under_Linux
it's actually pretty annoying
disappearedng_:you could mount it ?
yeah
disappearedng_:chown the directory it's mounted to to the regular user
disappearedng_:assuming it's mounted /media/disk, will be : sudo chown -R  disappearedng /media/disk   (correct username, course)
read only file system

I guess, I followed the guide http://wiki.netbsd.se/How_to_mount_FFS_partition_under_Linux completely
